value.title: DAX Fridays! #148: CONVERT and resolve variant data-type error
value.excerpt: Have you got this error in Power BI? "Expressions that yield variant data-type cannot be used to define calculated columns". If you have, check this video to learn how to fix it using the new DAX function CONVERT.  Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays

value.title: DAX Fridays! #149: REMOVEFILTERS
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will go through the new dax function that was introduced on Aug 2019 called REMOVEFILTERS.   Get Northwind Dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  Link to DAX Fridays survey: http://bit.ly/2MMM4KK   Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays #154: Dynamic currency conversion with DAX
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you an elegant and simple way to do currency conversion dynamically in power bi with dax.  Get the file from Kasper's blog post: https://www.kasperonbi.com/currency-conversion-in-dax-for-power-bi-and-ssas/  Do calculated columns in power query: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oqcWZXx70qs

value.title: DAX Fridays! #179: Use a slicer to highlight values instead of filter them in Power BI ðŸ˜Ž
value.excerpt: Did you know that you can use a slicer in Power BI to highlight values instead of filtering them?  Let me show you the technique here, but if you are up for it, give it a go before and let us know what you came up to!  Pass multiple values from a slicer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_k_Qxb6pyCc  iscrossfilter

value.title: DAX Fridays! #181: Can't covert text into dates using DAX? Here is why...
value.excerpt: You should use power query to convert text into dates in power bi, but if you have a direct query or live connection and you need to do it in DAX, here is a tutorial of what works, what doesnt and what to watch for.  Enjoy!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships.  Link to Power BI file: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/userelationship-dax

value.title: Dax Fridays #211: Add leading zeros to a column using DAX
value.excerpt: Adding leading zeros, is probably something that you should do alrealy in Power Query, but in this case I wanted that column to be created on the fly rather than adding it to the model, so I let me show you how I did it!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX Fridays! #24: Running/ Cumulative totals (w Pareto chart)
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how to calculate cumulative totals or running totals with DAX/ powerpivot.  We will calculate running totals with a Date and with another column (not a date).  Link to Matt's Blog post: http://exceleratorbi.com.au/cumulative-running-total-based-on-highest-value/  Link to

value.title: DAX Fridays! #42: SUBSTITUTE (multiple values)
value.excerpt: In today's video, we will learn how to use the DAX function SUBSTITUTE.  Substitute changes text for another text. We will do two examples, how to substitute one value for another and how to substitute multiple values.   Northwind dataset: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k3NMIlLffrU  EXCEL SURVEY: https://1drv.ms/xs/s!Ar8CDNp8cGTcgjaHonN82T8I1jQT

value.title: DAX Fridays! #48: TIME (Calculate working hours)
value.excerpt: In today's DAX Fridays we will learn how Power pivot or Power BI manages time using the TIME function. value.title: DAX Fridays! #66: TREATAS
value.excerpt: In this video we will go through the DAX function TREATAS.  The TREATAS DAX function allows us to create virtual relationships within tables or pass filters to tables that are not related.  Link to function in glossary:  https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/treatas-dax   Link to SQLBI blog post: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/propagate-filters-using-treatas-in-dax/

value.title: DAX Fridays! #79: KEEPFILTERS
